alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 9:46PM MST until February 14 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Espanola Valley, and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...Until 7 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area
